title: Illinois Sues Trump Administration Over National Guard Deployment
snippets: The parties are asking a judge to block the Trump administration from federalizing the Illinois National Guard and from sending to Illinois any guard members from other states, including Texas.
US state accuses Trump of 'unlawful and unconstitutional' use of National Guard in latest effort to stop deployment.

The Democratic-led state said the Trump administration's planned troop deployment is unconstitutional. A lawsuit said Americans should not "live under the threat of military occupation" for opposing the president.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiAFBVV95cUxPUVhfLTJLLVpld2FXbFlueVlESHZzUGpmNkt4SXlCaHJ4cFFXZTVpWE54d3FwdVBEaG50eFB1TTZEamh5MFozUS15VFBWa2xoR0d3NG54TzZnS3VvYVFTck9xRVVJMmNVTi05Rl9kOUpRQ1NXU1BoTWF2THZ1VVRvNElfc0VkcFM3?oc=5" target="_blank">Illinois sues Trump over National Guard dep

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMikAFBVV95cUxQSU83ZkFnMmR4eDlDN2l1Rk1DbVNjclFRaHM4VWZWcG1UWUJkbERQTE13MDBHTWVNRFRDcE1tWTc3NGx2TFJJTHRHN2pGQXROZ3FzR2I5Ny13eGpHSkZwVnBnOTA0YXU2bl9NUDdCbGtYZzRoS1Rvb05MMGVWYVJqQjRRNTJ1aUpIZG9WRFRaN3o?oc=5" target="_blank">Judge temporarily blocks Trump f
'He is using our military as political pawns to build up his own ego,' said California Gov. Gavin Newsom, who also vowed to sue.
The administration is trying to send hundreds of members of the Texas National Guard to Chicago.
titles: Illinois and Chicago sue the Trump administration over National Guard deployment
Illinois lawsuit seeks to block Trump sending National Guard to Chicago
US: Illinois sues Trump over Chicago troop deployment
Illinois sues Trump over National Guard deployment to Chicago - Axios
Judge temporarily blocks Trump from any sending National Guard troops to Oregon - Axios
Illinois, Chicago sue Trump admin over National Guard deployment
Illinois Sues Trump—Just Like Oregon And California—Challenging National Guard Orders
summary: Illinois has filed a lawsuit against the Trump administration, challenging the decision to deploy National Guard troops to the state, labeling it "unlawful and unconstitutional." The suit argues against the federalization of the Illinois National Guard and the deployment of out-of-state guard members, including those from Texas, claiming it threatens citizens with "military occupation." A judge has temporarily blocked the Trump administration's move. California's Governor, Gavin Newsom, criticized the use of the military as political tools and announced intentions to sue as well.

title: Connor McDavid Signs $25M Extension with Oilers, Avoids Free Agency
snippets: Star center Connor McDavid will remain with the Edmonton Oilers, signing a two-year contract extension with an average annual value of $12.5 million.
The NHL's biggest star will be staying in Edmonton

Connor McDavid isn’t going anywhere. The Edmonton Oilers star, who was set to be an unrestricted free agent next year, has inked a two-year contract extension that carries an average annual value of $12.5 million. McDavid’s extension comes on the eve of the NHL regular season; the captain was set to
McDavid signs 2-year, $25 million contract with Oilers&nb

Edmonton Oilers GM Stan Bowman discusses how the Connor McDavid extension came together, detailing how negotiating with a superstar of his stature is a unique process, and why the future for the team was an important factor in the captain’s decision.
titles: McDavid signs 2-year, $25M extension with Oilers
Connor McDavid, Oilers agree to contract extension: Edmonton signs three-time league MVP to two-year deal
Connor McDavid Signs Team-Friendly Extension With Oilers
McDavid signs 2-year, $25 million contract with Oilers - NHL.com
Oilers’ Bowman explains how McDavid extension talks came together
summary: Connor McDavid, the Edmonton Oilers' star center, has signed a two-year contract extension, avoiding free agency next year. The deal is worth $25 million, with an average annual value of $12.5 million. This contract ensures McDavid, the NHL's leading star, remains with the Oilers, as confirmed by the team's GM, Stan Bowman. The extension was finalized just before the start of the NHL regular season.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell's Supreme Court Appeal Declined, Transferred to Texas Camp
snippets: The British socialite is serving a 20-year prison sentence on sex-trafficking charges related to former boyfriend Jeffrey Epstein.
Former girlfriend of convicted sex abuser Jeffrey Epstein is serving a 20-year prison sentence for sex trafficking.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMifEFVX3lxTE10cURkM1huYWlic0RVWWJVQ0F1ZUprbUYzdkE3Y0VhTUZSR04yV2s4Y0hoWHlvMU9aWkRabVdpTzNxc1h0N05SUGphQUxEUEh2azBRRUFhb2xrYmY5SHBUYkFoUzYxTmthQjhyTV9nejE5OUNBZ0JsZzhNSUQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Supreme Court rejects Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell's

The Supreme Court has declined to take up the appeal of Maxwell, who was contesting her prosecution and conviction on grounds that the government had violated an agreement made with Jeffrey Epstein before his death.
Ghislaine Maxwell, the convicted procurer of Jeffrey Epstein, may now focus efforts to get a pardon or sentence commutation from President Donald Trump.
titles: US Supreme Court rejects Ghislaine Maxwell appeal in Epstein case
US Supreme Court declines to hear Ghislaine Maxwell appeal
Supreme Court rejects Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell's appeal - Axios
WATCH:  Supreme Court denies Ghislaine Maxwell appeal
Supreme Court rejects appeal of Ghislaine Maxwell for Epstein abetting conviction
summary: Ghislaine Maxwell, associated with Jeffrey Epstein, is serving a 20-year sentence for sex trafficking and related crimes as of 2022. Her appeal to the US Supreme Court was declined. Maxwell attempted to argue her indictment was invalid due to Epstein's 2007 non-prosecution agreement. Recently, she was transferred from a low-security prison in Florida to a minimum-security camp in Texas.

title: ICC Convicts Janjaweed Leader of War Crimes in Darfur
snippets: The International Criminal Court in The Hague handed down its first-ever Darfur war crimes conviction, finding Janjaweed leader Ali Kushayb, guilty of atrocities committed more than two decades ago.
The International Criminal Court has found Sudanese militia chief Ali Muhammad Ali Abd-Al-Rahman guilty of war crimes.
The 27 guilty verdicts are the first handed down by The Hague-based court over war crimes in Sudanese region in 2000s.
For the first time, the ICC has found a militia leader guilty of war crimes committed in Sudan's Darfur region more than 20 years ago.

Janjaweed commander Ali Muhammad Ali Abd-al-Rahman, known as Ali Kushayb, found guilty over atrocities

The international criminal court has convicted a leader of the Janjaweed militia of playing a leading role in a campaign of atrocities committed in the Sudanese region of Darfur more than
titles: ICC finds former Sudan militia leader guilty of war crimes in Darfur
ICC convicts first militia leader for brutal attacks in Darfur
ICC convicts ex-Janjaweed leader Ali Kushayb of war crimes in Darfur
Darfur militia leader convicted by ICC for war crimes
ICC convicts former Sudan militia leader for war crimes in Darfur
summary: The International Criminal Court (ICC) has convicted Janjaweed militia leader Ali Muhammad Ali Abd-Al-Rahman, known as Ali Kushayb, of war crimes in Sudan's Darfur region, marking the court's first conviction for crimes in this area. Abd-Al-Rahman was found guilty on 27 counts of war crimes committed over 20 years ago.

title: Pro-Israel, Anti-'Woke' Commentator to Lead US News Network
snippets: Provocative columnist Bari Weiss publicly quit the New York Times in 2020, then cofounded The Free Press as an alternative to legacy media. Here's what to know as she takes the helm of CBS News.
Appointment of media figure known for pro-Israel, anti-'woke' stances comes as US media firms feel Trump pressure.
Bari Weiss, founder of The Free Press, is joining CBS News as its first editor-in-chief following her site’s acquisition by Paramount Skydance.
titles: Who is Bari Weiss? CBS News' new editor-in-chief is a vocal critic of legacy media
Conservative writer Bari Weiss named editor-in-chief of CBS News
Who Is Bari Weiss? What To Know About The New CBS News Editor-In-Chief
summary: A commentator known for pro-Israel and anti-'woke' views has been appointed to lead a prominent US news network, marking their return five years after leaving the New York Times under tense circumstances. This move comes as US media companies, including CBS News' owner Paramount, which is acquiring the Free Press, a media startup, face pressure in the current political climate influenced by Trump.

title: Connor McDavid Signs Extension with Oilers Through 2027-28
snippets: No. 97 is sticking with the Oilers through 2027-28 -- with a wide range of downstream impacts around the NHL.
Connor McDavid is sticking around in Edmonton for a few more years, but the length of the new contract is a pretty telling sign.

summary: Connor McDavid has extended his contract with the Edmonton Oilers through the 2027-28 season. The decision, discussed by Mark Spector on The FAN Hockey Show, reflects strategic planning for the Oilers' future success around McDavid. This extension is expected to have significant implications for the NHL.

title: Trump Raises Tariff on Brazil to 40%; Discusses Cooperation with Lula
snippets: Trump had imposed a 40% tariff on Brazil in July on top of a 10% earlier even though US has a trade surplus with Brazil.

Brazil's leader held a "positive" call with US President Donald Trump, and discussed punitive measures imposed by the US president who has claimed a criminal case against Brazil's ex-president Jair Bolsonaro was biased.

Presidents spoke on a video call as expert speculates that Haiti could be an area where the two leaders can cooperate

Brazil’s president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, has urged Donald Trump to scrap tariffs on his country’s imports and sanctions against its officials, as the two men held what
titles: Lula asks Trump to lift 40 percent tariff from Brazilian goods
Brazil's Lula asks Trump to lift tariffs in video call
Brazil’s president asks US to scrap tariffs in ‘friendly’ call with Trump
summary: In July, President Trump imposed a 40% tariff on Brazil, adding to a previous 10% tariff despite the US having a trade surplus with Brazil. Following a "positive" video call between Brazil's President Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva and Trump, discussions were held on the punitive measures, including tariffs and sanctions against Brazilian officials. The call also touched on cooperation opportunities, such as in Haiti. Lula urged Trump to reconsider the tariffs and sanctions.

title: France's PM Lecornu Resigns After Less Than 24 Hours Amid Political Crisis
snippets: Sébastien Lecornu, who quit on Monday, is asked by Emmanuel Macron to quickly negotiate a stability plan
Sébastien Lecornu, a former defense minister, was in the job less than a month. He was appointed after a no-confidence vote toppled his predecessor.
Sébastien Lecornu’s departure ratcheted up pressure on President Emmanuel Macron to call snap parliamentary elections.
titles: France in fresh political and market turmoil after prime minister resigns
Prime minister of France resigns hours after naming new government
French Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu Resigns
summary: Sébastien Lecornu, France's newly appointed Prime Minister, resigned less than 24 hours after forming his government and less than a month in office, citing deep political divisions and criticism from various factions, including threats from rightwing allies to withdraw support. His resignation, accepted by President Emmanuel Macron, follows criticism over the largely unchanged cabinet lineup and plunges the country into a political crisis. Lecornu, a former defense minister, had assumed the role after a no-confidence vote ousted his predecessor.

title: Netanyahu Optimistic on Hostage Release by Oct. 13 Amid Gaza Ceasefire Talks
snippets: The talks are expected to be among the most consequential since the start of the war two years ago.
Negotiators from Israel and Hamas are heading to Sharm El-Sheikh, Egypt, to start indirect talks about ending the Israel-Gaza war.
Trump urges mediators to “move fast” as key Gaza talks begin.
Though significant issues remain to be hashed out between Israel and Hamas, some are saying that after two years of death and destruction, a breakthrough may be near.
Israel and Hamas said they will work with President Trump’s proposal to end the Gaza war. But persistent sticking points could derail a diplomatic breakthrough.

Hamas’s acceptance of key conditions of deal galvanises momentum but large gaps remain between camps

titles: Israel and Hamas begin indirect talks in Egypt on Trump's Gaza peace plan

Will Trump’s Gaza Peace Plan Work?

Trump’s Gaza Peace Plan: What to Know
Israel and Hamas begin indirect talks as hopes rise of ending Gaza war
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu expressed hope for the release of all hostages by Hamas by Oct. 13, following partial agreement to President Trump's 20-point Gaza ceasefire plan. While Hamas has agreed to release hostages and discuss governing Gaza with Palestinian technocrats, negotiations on several aspects of the plan remain. Both Israel and Hamas have shown willingness to work towards ending the conflict, but unresolved issues could impede a diplomatic breakthrough. The US President has cautioned Hamas about the limited time available to finalize the deal.

title: Trump Announces Truck Levies Before Trade Talks with Canadian PM
snippets: Announcement comes on eve of talks in Washington with Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney
The announcement comes a day before Trump is set to host Prime Minister Mark Carney in the White House, with trade dominating the agenda between the two leaders.
Trump originally said last month that heavy-duty truck levies would start Oct. 1

title: Rescue Efforts Underway for Hikers Trapped on Everest's North Slope
snippets: An effort is underway to rescue hundreds of hikers who became trapped on Mount Everest due to an unexpected blizzard.
Some 350 hikers were rescued and 200 remain stranded, Chinese state media reported Monday, as rescue efforts continued in China’s Tibet Autonomous Region.
The snowfall buried tents and reduced visibility. The local authorities said that they were in contact with the hikers and that rescue efforts were underway.
titles: WATCH:  Hundreds of hikers trapped by blizzard on Mount Everest
Snowstorm traps hundreds on Mount Everest
Snowstorm Traps Hundreds of Everest Hikers
summary: Rescue workers in Tibet are assisting hundreds of hikers trapped by a snowstorm on Mount Everest's northern slope. Chinese state media reported that tents at tourist campsites were damaged, and there are casualties. The heavy snowfall has buried tents and blocked rescue roads, but local authorities are in contact with the hikers and rescue efforts are ongoing.

title: Social Security Chief Named IRS CEO in Major Leadership Shift
snippets: Social Security chief to be IRS CEO  Axios
Bisignano will report to Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent, who currently serves as acting commissioner of the IRS.
The appointment, which would not require Senate confirmation, puts Frank Bisignano at the helm of two embattled, data-heavy agencies.

An ‘IRS CEO’ now exists, and Social Security Administrator Frank Bisignano is the first to fill the position
Social Security chief tapped to oversee another struggling agency: The IRS
summary: The Social Security chief has been appointed as the IRS CEO, a position that does not require Senate confirmation. This move marks a significant leadership change within two major U.S. government agencies.

title: 2025 Nobel Prize in Medicine Awarded for Autoimmunity Research
snippets: The prize-winning discovery explains how the immune system attacks hostile infections, but not the body's own cells.

Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi will be awarded the Nobel Prize in physiology or medicine for their instrumental work in improving our understanding of how the immune system functions.
The 2025 Nobel prize in physiology or medicine has gone to Mary Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell and Shimon Sakaguchi for their discoveries around how we keep our immune system under control
titles: Scientists win Nobel Prize for discovering why immune system does not destroy the body
Trio wins Nobel Prize in medicine for immune system research
Nobel prize for medicine goes to trio for work on immune tolerance
summary: Mary E. Brunkow, Fred Ramsdell, and Shimon Sakaguchi were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for their groundbreaking research on how the immune system is regulated to prevent it from attacking the body's own tissues. Their work, which involves the identification of mechanisms that help maintain immune system balance, has been pivotal in advancing our understanding of autoimmunity. This US-Japanese team's discoveries have significantly contributed to the field of immunology.

title: Trump Optimistic on Israel-Hamas Talks Amid Gaza Violence

This comes as talks are set to begin, following a deadly day in Gaza where 63 people were killed by Israeli forces. Trump has urged for quick action in these discussions.

The judge, Astrit Kalaja, was
titles: Man on trial in Albania kills judge, injures two others in shooting

Cooper was celebrated for her engaging storytelling and vibrant characters, selling millions of copies worldwide. Fans and readers are invited to share their memories and tributes.
